abstract: Bank of China said its bid to raise up to $8.9 billion should give it enough capital for the next three years, seeking to assure markets its second major fund-raising this year will mend its stretched balance sheet for the foreseeable future, Reuters reported.
snippet: Bank of China said its bid to raise up to $8.9 billion should give it enough capital for the next three years, seeking to assure markets its second major fund-raising this year will mend its stretched balance sheet for the foreseeable future, Reut...
lead_paragraph: Bank of China, seeking to reassure markets that it is mending its stretched balance sheet, said its plan to raise up to $8.9 billion in a stock offering should give it enough capital for the next three years, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Bank of China’s Share Sale Surprises Market
